locale.name: ca_ES
locale.message: Mòdul DOI
This plugin enables the assignment of the Digital Object Identifiers to issues, articles, galleys and supplementary files in OJS.
Configuració del mòdul DOI
Please configure the DOI plug-in to be able to manage and use DOIs in OJS:
Contingut de la revista
Please choose the objects DOIs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Digital Object Identifiers (DOI) assigned:
Issues
Articles
Galleys
Supplementary Files
Prefix DOI
The DOI Prefix is assigned by registration agencies (e.g. CrossRef) and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234):
The DOI prefix is mandatory and must be in the form 10.xxxx.
DOI Suffix
A DOI suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same DOI prefix assigned:

Use the pattern entered below to generate DOI suffixes. Use %j for journal initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the issue number, %Y for the year, %a for the OJS article ID, %g for the OJS galley ID, %s for the OJS supplementary file ID and %p for the page number.
for issues
for articles
for galleys
for supplementary files.
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create a DOI such as 10.1234/vol3iss2pp230
Use default patterns.

%j.v%vi%i for issues
%j.v%vi%i.%a for articles
%j.v%vi%i.%a.g%g for galleys
%j.v%vi%i.%a.s%s for supplementary files.
Enter an individual DOI suffix for each published item. You'll find an additional DOI input field on each item's meta-data page.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for issues.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for articles.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for galleys.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for supplementary files.
Reassignar DOIs

If you change your DOI configuration, DOIs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the DOI configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing DOIs so that the new settings will take effect with existing articles.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing DOIs?
DOI
issue
article
galley
supplementary file

What you see is a preview of the DOI that may be incomplete. A DOI has not yet been generated. Publishing the issue and viewing the public {$pubObjectType} page will automatically generate a unique DOI for this {$pubObjectType}.
The given DOI suffix is already in use for another published item. Please enter a unique DOI suffix for each item.

NOTA: Quan utilitzeu DOIs de CrossRef, si us plau seleccioneu articles. Els articles es comprenen com a un treball, dit d'un altre manera, una entitat intel·lectual i artística de contingut. Per tant, l'article es l'objecte en el que el DOI de CrossRef es basarà per a l'exportació i el registre.
